Prove that there are infinitely many primes of the form 4k + 3, where k is a non-negative integer. Provide the key steps of the proof. (JEE Advanced level)
expected_answer: Assume finitely many primes of the form 4k + 3: p1, p2, ..., pm. Construct N = 4p1p2...pm + 3. N is of the form 4k + 3. Since N is odd and greater than 3, it is either prime or composite. If prime, it is a new prime of the form 4k + 3. If composite, it has a prime factor of the form 4k + 3 (since primes of the form 4k + 1 cannot produce N ≡ 3 (mod 4)). This contradicts the assumption, so there are infinitely many such primes.
